meanings.definition: Tending to go backward or recede.
meanings.sent1: The shy boy's recessive nature made him avoid large crowds.
meanings.sent2: The fading sunlight cast a recessive glow over the horizon.
meanings.sent3: The recessive turtle decided to retreat into its shell for some alone time.
meanings.sent4: Her recessive thoughts slowly faded away like distant memories.
meanings.sent5: The recessive colors of the painting gave it a dreamy, nostalgic feel.

meanings.definition: Capable of being pushed back or in.
meanings.sent1: The flexible material was recessive, allowing it to be easily folded.
meanings.sent2: The recessive button on the toy car made it collapse into a compact size.
meanings.sent3: The recessive spring in the pen made it retract with a satisfying click.
meanings.sent4: His recessive stance in the argument allowed him to yield to a compromise.
meanings.sent5: The recessive door handle could be pushed in to open the secret passage.
